column5: no problem, i just remembered a time when i thought things would never get better and felt the need to spread some hope

i completely get you, it took a long time (im 2 years out) to trust people again and tbh i still have a hard time letting people in. give yourself space, but try not to see other people as the enemy; everyone hurts each other sometimes, its only a small group of people who do it on purpose. feeling extra wounded by the things people say and do is a trauma response but i believe you can get through it and learn to not only trust people again but build good boundaries. â¤ï¸ all the luck in the world

uhmm no, even before the pandemic, if anything is coming back out of your stomach thats a solid â€œyou need to call outâ€. Now, thereâ€™s all the more reason to play it safe and call out if you need to.

its exactly this â€“ also why they emphasize lyra and headspace. your anxiety and mental breakdowns in the backroom isnâ€™t the **Third Place**, *heavens* no, the problem is **you**.

donâ€™t get me wrong iâ€™m all for mental health support, I just donâ€™t trust starbucks to have our health in mind after what the past year has been.

its just a byproduct of corporations with high demand, the beans get roasted into the next millennium for packaging ğŸ¤·â€â™€ï¸ they definitely taste gross if they cool down but the espresso already had that taste, its just harder to notice when its hot enough to properly mix with milk and sugar

the drinks are made of the same proportions so as long as youâ€™re not filling up the entire blender it makes no sense why it would â€œruin the flavorâ€. if it works for baking, smoothies, etc. then fraps are not something special.

first of all, weâ€™re talking about liquid sugar but more importantly, iâ€™ve heard people say it affects the taste but that makes about as much sense as â€œshots dieâ€. the flavor wasnâ€™t there to begin with, youâ€™re just more likely to notice it when youâ€™re looking for something to be *wrong*.
canâ€™t wait for a barista on tik tok to promote it like any of us have the TIME

i would emphasize the amount of time and product she â€˜s wasting and talk about how youâ€™ve tried to â€œmake the moment rightâ€. this type of behavior isnâ€™t okay and should not be something anyone has to deal with *especially* during this time

baristas are more than proud to serve people who are working atm or should i say â€œother essential workersâ€. a lot of them are just disheartened to get people that come in for 6 frappuccinos and 8 cake pops that are usually families who could bear to stay home. then theres orders like this monstrosity in the photo that i can only hope is being repurposed throughout the week and not slurped up in one gulp.

i know we all feel a responsibility to our team but thats the same mindset that keeps people from calling out when theyâ€™re sick in the first place. Almost every major health organization is saying non-essential employees need to stay home. By taking the 30 you are not only protecting yourself, but youâ€™re protecting your community. 

Besides, you said the rest of your household is still working, right? So if one of them were to get it and pass it throughout your house and you took it to work, wouldnâ€™t that be worse? As someone else mentioned, you can use this time to be a team player for your own household and your store will manage. Flattening the curve means limiting the number of people you can spread the virus to, staying home when we have that option is for the good of everyone.

ive had a bunch of regulars, local employees, medical staff, and transients that i have no problem serving but encourage to stay safe.

... THEN i have the vans of families acting like theyâ€™re on vacation or this one lady who asked if we were gonna stay open and then completely ignored me while she stayed on the phone at the drive thru like ğŸ¤• the only solace iâ€™ve found is that taking their money means less partners will take a hit when the companyâ€™s revenue starts to dwindle.
same to you!!

yes! our manager stepped down just before this happened and its been so much harder to get a clear picture of whatâ€™s going on at the corporate level. iâ€™ve heard things from here before i heard them from our SSVs and interim manager (really just an SM who works across town and has been checking on us).

i am one of those partners who have freaked out at work, the communication in this company is being really muddled up and its understandable that they fucked up since the start but they really need to revise the company culture

im glad theyve finally opened up the policy to include partners who donâ€™t feel safe for cat pay but theyâ€™re still downplaying the importance of this issue and trying to squeeze out the last bit of revenue before we go on lockdown and its not right.

i get this is going to have disastrous economic consequences and im sure everyone up top is just as disoriented and worried about what this could mean for the future but the cost of human life (from the virus and from people getting turned away from overcrowded hospitals) is worth shutting the whole thing down now.

same, i get people are trying to cope so even if its irritating as a concept i can understand it. plus seeing regulars is so conflicting cause its nice but i want them to stay home and safe. as for medical staff and transients, Iâ€™m more than happy to serve.
honestly, i get they want to avoid scandals and outrage but not communicating with partners is causing so much more of an uproar. we need transparency as much as we need support right now.
i believe it only applies to corporate stores and iâ€™m not entirely sure how it works for licensed stores but i would maybe contact your manager? sorry i really wish i had a better answer

oh sorry i forgot to mention this change came as of this morning. why it isnâ€™t being communicated company-wide is beyond me but if you donâ€™t feel like bringing it up with your manager again i would just try calling PCC

catastrophe pay has now been extended to include partners who just want to self-quarantine because they feel unsafe! contact your manager or PCC

agreed. clearly very big decisions hit them all at once and i can appreciate the human aspect of how badly this has gone. honestly if they had openly communicated and said â€œwe are working on a way to structure financial assistance for our partners during this difficult timeâ€ i think a lot of us would have felt less like we were thrown into the fire.

i feel like (i wanna assume) they did it the way they did to prioritize partners who were at-risk before rolling out PTO to everyone else. but honestly, staying open during nationwide shut downs atm still looks really bad, and i know its not just starbucks but a lot of companies.

and even then, from what i understand, the extension of catastrophe pay to all partners still hasnâ€™t been clearly communicated, i found out from here and from someone who had to contact our regional manager.

fuck the normalcy of the customers this is a pandemic - an international emergency, normal is GONE and it wonâ€™t be back for a long time and people need to accept that rather than keep trying to order matcha frappuccinos. this is hard on *everyone* but the lockdowns and quarantines are for a *reason*

wow okay seeing it in writing makes it make more sense. peopleâ€™s responses are making me feel so much less embarrassed. my ex would do a lot of the same things, i had to be available for him whenever he wanted and since he had my location he would facetime me any time i was any where different like at a friends house. he was super subtle about being insecure and controlling and put me through a lot emotionally so i know he was abusive but the fact such a short time can have long-term effects is shocking. glad youâ€™re out of that and recovering tho!

oof classic denial, its meant to make you doubt yourself and help them uphold whatever image they want to believe about themselves. they go in feeding you a fantasy about perfect love and go out acting like it was all a dream and *youâ€™re* the one lying about what happened.

im so sorry that happened to you thats absolutely awful. please keep one thing in mind: you are not to blame! if you felt paranoid about him cheating and it turned out to be true it sounds like you were picking up on his behavior, not that you feeling insecure *caused* it. its really fucked up for him to project that onto you; he did an awful thing and didnâ€™t take responsibility for himself.

yeah i would just change your passwords just in case. if its him he either wants to get access to your messages or he *wants* you to confront him about it; i canâ€™t stress this enough: *donâ€™t*. it could also be a coincidence but the dates lining up is definitely odd. 

my ex didnâ€™t try hacking my social media but the jackass definitely tried to get into my uber account ğŸ™„ probably wanted me to pay for his ride to a new supply

stores canâ€™t turn off their mobile orders at will, they have to call their district and have it turned off by upper management and they only ever do that if thereâ€™s a problem so this is probably a problem with the app or that starbucks just frequently runs into issues like broken down machines

i saw myself in your post and it took me a long time to *fully* see my exâ€™s behavior, too. again, good luck working through all of that and iâ€™m glad you were able to find someone who is supportive

well the closeness in events probably made the memories associated but he sounds abusive himself; i wouldnâ€™t doubt dealing with that lack of support, shaming, and emotional neglect from a partner either left its own scars or made the ones you already had worse. people donâ€™t have to physically lay hands on you to hurt you; just cause he was charming in the beginning doesnâ€™t mean he wasnâ€™t toxic underneath. iâ€™m sorry all of this has happened to you, i wish you all the luck in the world with healing.

had the same experience; wasnâ€™t any better because i went to school with him and was on edge at all times. as far as places you used to go with them, you can take someone along with you for comfort and only leave when the anxiety gets to be too much. as far as being afraid of them, its really hard to reprogram that but it gets better with therapy. hopefully this person is no longer a danger to you and if thats the case you can establish safety plans (â€œif i see them and we make eye contact i will look awayâ€ â€œif they talk to me i will excuse myself and walk awayâ€ â€œif they try something i will call for helpâ€) just something to help your brain deal with all the what-ifs and feeling of danger. as far as how to act; it really depends on the abuser but i would maybe say: unfazed, like your abuser isnâ€™t even someone you know, the less of a reaction you give, the better. 

mainly, i would just say to give yourself credit; healing takes time and its going to be a while before your spaces feel sacred again and you can confidently go places. celebrate the little victories and try not to beat yourself up if you feel held back.

is â€œaggressively neutralâ€ corporate-speak for â€œtastes like cardboardâ€

its not just your store; this happens every fiscal year. starbucks cuts back on labor (i donâ€™t know the actual economics of it but it has to do with â€œoverspendingâ€ on labor throughout the year). this year in particular has been really bad especially because the holidays were insanely busy. people have been posting on this sub for months about how awful it was and many people have left the company because of it. it should go back to normal in the spring when business picks up again. it also affected some districts/stores more than others depending on how busy they are and how management handles the cut in hours.

you could try toughing it out, especially since you just started but honestly i donâ€™t think anyone would blame you for trying to find a better job.
imma go out on a limb and say that the new honey almond flat white is officially *worse* than the protein blended cold brew â€“ flavor-wise at least
a hero.

mine had followed me on tumblr for a couple years because a mutual friend tried (and failed lol) to set us up the first time. i hadnâ€™t realized until we matched on tinder and he brought it up. we bonded over having â€œknownâ€ each other for so long but later on i realized he had years of access to my interests, political beliefs, emotions, and hobbies. ill never know how much of what we â€œsharedâ€ was real and at this point iâ€™m afraid to find out.

was going to mention this. identifying part of oneâ€™s identity is a process for people and part of that process is *becoming* the identity and being consumed by it. everyone is at different stages and while it might seem annoying (especially if youâ€™ve already been through it) for someone to act like they have one singular personality trait, it may be that theyâ€™re just enthusiastic about having found something about themselves that they *can* share with the world; so they do. once theyâ€™ve gotten comfortable, they usually stop talking about it and start merging whatever it is with the rest of their identity.

that being said, sometimes queer people who donâ€™t know a lot of other queer people *really* ramp up the LGBT+ identity when they meet someone like them because *no one else would understand what theyâ€™re talking about* â€“ again it comes from a place of comfort and enthusiasm.

you described my ex almost to a T. i had the same experience; he could be incredibly sweet. especially at the end, he seemed to genuinely recognize that his behavior had been abusive and painful. he didnâ€™t necessarily apologize but he told me i deserved better than him.

flash forward to the fallout and suddenly he was â€œtoo goodâ€ for me. he went from telling me he still loved me and â€œcould never replace meâ€ (i caught him on dating apps) to wanting nothing to do with me and claiming that i wanted to â€œbe someone that had dated himâ€. he fell apart after us but still treated me like i was insignificant, an annoyance.

i always wondered which was the real him: the one who could be attentive, considerate, romantic, and vulnerable; or the one who was disrespectful, spiteful, and unloaded backhanded compliments, gaslighting, triangulation, and made me feel like i was nothing to him after making me feel like he and i were the whole world. it takes a lot to see it but the painful person is more prominent, no matter how much humanity you can see in them. people shouldnâ€™t make you feel like you are worthless, especially when its a partner.

i think when your partner is inconsistent, its good to take an objective look at them as well as yourself; specifically how you feel and the effect that person has had on you. if the answer is that you have left broken, confused, and miserable â€“ both with and without them; they werenâ€™t any good for you.

absolutely! like if someone needs special accommodations i donâ€™t mind doing what i can. but those customers complaining about whip cream at the handoff are probably lactose intolerant which i know firsthand can be awful but is definitely not an allergy.

god yes, like i know weâ€™re not liable if someone does end up getting sick but i still wouldnâ€™t feel comfortable serving anything that could potentially be contaminated. the moment that word even comes up i have the exposure spiel ready because i want them to know that realistically nothing we use is completely safe, even when we had different pitchers/utensils.

thats fair and iâ€™m glad you were able to find a solution so that she can still enjoy starbucks without having to worry about exposure and iâ€™m sorry your mom has to deal with that. that makes it all the more irritating when people claim to have an allergy that they, in fact, donâ€™t.

omfg i swear the number of times iâ€™ve heard about â€œallergiesâ€ so people think they can scare us into making their drinks right. if you are that worried about your dairy allergy you probably should avoid a shop where **everything contains dairy or is in close contact with milk**.

i once had a lady argue with me because her daughter was allergic to chocolate, and she insisted that she wanted white mocha instead because it didnâ€™t contain chocolate ğŸ™„ even when i read that cacao was an ingredient she basically told me she knew better than me like okay lady do you, hope you have an epipen then
we have one too, sheâ€™ll get drinks for everyone in her office but sheâ€™s very sweet and polite and sheâ€™ll always tip us and be super appreciative

ooh i had a regular give me the stink eye for this! i never really see him and frankly donâ€™t really like him because heâ€™s kinda cocky but one time he very confidently walked up to the register and just said â€œthe usualâ€ while on his phone (not even making eye contact). i gave a very cheery â€œsure! what is it?â€ and you could tell he was just as mad as he was embarrassed.

Thank you i really appreciate that! I feel like even when ive been closed off and *stifle* my empathy, i still bring in the same kind of person and am even drawn to them too lmao its been something im working on noticing.

But on the bright side, like you said, its become a lot easier to see the red flags and when its time to leave them behind.
literally you dont realize theyre trying to mimic you until theyre gone and you see the mask fall off its terrifying

wow two things about this post stood out to me hard: 

1) the whole thing about narcs stalking their next supply to project the perfect partner. i remember in the beginning when my ex would call me every day and ask me 1000 questions about myself like he was genuinely interested there was a moment where i woke up at 5am (after being on the phone with him all night, of course) because i got a notification that someone had liked one of my tumblr posts and the username was vaguely similar to his last name but wasnâ€™t the blog he had followed me on. when i checked it the post had been unliked so i couldnâ€™t see the notification on my app and i couldnâ€™t find the blog after that. it was weird and clearly an accident and i thought it might have been him but i never brought it up and forgot about it.

2) a coworker of mine who ive been getting close to was venting to me about how he gets â€œboredâ€ in all of his relationships and then everyone he talks to â€œgoes crazyâ€ over him and â€œgets obsessedâ€ and the first thing i thought of was my ex; especially because theyâ€™re similar in a lot of ways. ğŸ˜· im either a fucking magnet or i canâ€™t tell what healthy is anymore.
even better when they say it on the drive thru â€œcan i get a matcha latte and a mocha frappuccino? and for mine can you put extra caramel?â€ ğŸ™„ how am i supposed to know which one is yours?
my favorite is when its not even their drink but they wanna be all nosy ğŸ˜‚

i always give new people the same spiel: training takes less than a month but no one gets good at this job in the first three months. it takes a long time to learn everything and even longer to get good at it and it can feel incredibly intimidating especially when you notice other partners getting upset that they canâ€™t rely on you yet but it goes away once you start getting comfortable. just donâ€™t be afraid to ask questions and if you can, get to know your coworkers; the job is a lot less stressful when you know people have your back :)

shifts tend to place people based on their strengths which is great and all until you have partners that are really only experienced in one or two roles. had a similar experience always being on drive until i said something about it to the shifts.

yeah no same; work can be absolute hell yet ill still find myself picking up shifts because its better than having to face things iâ€™m avoiding. i even used to do my homework at work off the clock just to get out of my own head. kinda funny in that way to be using a stressful place as a coping mechanism.

yes, yes it can. mine and i were 20 and everything you described, i went through too. just because the abuse was subtle on his part doesnâ€™t mean it didnâ€™t happen, it means he was good at hiding it. you regret it, right? you feel like shit because you fell apart trying to keep a relationship together even though he was ripping you apart without lifting a finger? that guilt isnâ€™t something they feel.

hanging out with exâ€™s, lying to you, making you chase for his affection â€“ even just acknowledgment, being â€œcalmâ€ when youâ€™re hurting so you look like a nutjob while he looks like the bigger person â€“ its almost worse than the kind of abuse thats up front because you leave feeling like something terrible happened to you and you canâ€™t figure out what it was. its hard to wrap your head around it because you want so desperately to have been the problem â€“ why? because if youâ€™re the problem you can fix it

forgive yourself for falling apart; recognize the things you regret and work on them so that you donâ€™t carry that pain with you and into other relationships. what happened to you was real and youâ€™re learning to heal from it and thatâ€™s okay.
no literally this and the fact starbucks made a public declaration last year RIGHT BEFORE LABOR CUTS that they were going to get more invested in mental health makes me want to vomit

yupp pretty much on the nose. one thing to consider too is that sometimes they use compliments as a weapon. what might seem like them praising someone else can double as a reminder that you arenâ€™t that other person. it can serve as a way to idealize someone else and subtly devalue you at the same time.

it may seem like an oxymoron but you have to remember that they are not logical. my ex swore he was never wrong about anything and bragged about himself constantly. yet he still admitted to me that he thought he wasnâ€™t good enough for himself â€“ that his inner self wasnâ€™t worth the beautiful, talented person he was on the outside. they are incredibly insecure in the sense that they never think they are truly good enough but they hide behind a delusional faÃ§ade of being better than anyone else. again, far from straight-forward, logical thinking.

it happens; its hard not to tbh. we learn to love past some of the hardest shit and when you manage to fall for someone that much and really see passed their most hurtful qualities â€“ its hard not to keep caring about them and wonder if their good side will ever stick around. i canâ€™t imagine how much harder that is having to keep a connection with them for your kids.

donâ€™t beat yourself up about wanting a second chance. i struggled with the exact same thing â€“ i *knew* he was no good for me but hearing something, *anything* from him that would have proved he cared even a little bit would have made me run back faster than my feet would have carried me

it helps to remember the bad times â€“ the times they leave you crying, hurting, and confused. it helps you see both sides of him as the same person and it might not make the longing stop but it makes it easier to have the willpower to put your phone down so you donâ€™t press send or call them when youâ€™re vulnerable. good luck, honestly

mine did the same thing; youâ€™re not alone. it depends on two things: whether or not theyve found a new supply and how good they are at protecting their image. mine was dating other people towards the end cause he saw i was getting tired of his shit â€“ not cheating, as in hook ups and side hoes; he was *dating*, delivering the lovebombing he poured over me onto someone else.

he also kept it airtight, his image and reputation were valuable to him; groveling to an ex was *beneath* him and seeing as how i was clearly a mess over him â€“ sobbing, shaking, and moving at the pace of a sack of sand â€“ he was â€œtoo goodâ€ for me. 

the absolute best thing you can do is happiness. live happy, free, and do as you please and he will *writhe* with jealousy. i guarantee you that if he is in any way still in contact, he is watching you â€“ noticing any little thing you post and reading for a subtext that proves youâ€™re still hurting over him; any little sign that he was important to you and he will not make it obvious.

at some point, I started posting really normal stuff â€“ i went out with a couple friends, started drawing again, proclaiming that I was â€œworking on myselfâ€. I didnâ€™t notice until much later but the more i posted to make it look like i was fine (i was trying to recover my own reputation after a few messy online meltdowns), his social media ended up getting messier than mine. videos of him being wasted posted on his story, bizarre behavior plastered all over his snapchat, vague references to captions i had posted on instagram, and suddenly he was hanging out with another ex (that he dangled in my face and knew i was jealous of) with the caption â€œmissed you â¤ï¸â€. a friend of mine pointed out that he was trying to make me jealous and it wasnâ€™t in a healthy way â€“ that he was clearly toxic.

I resisted the urge to feed into his ego, tried to move on and keep healing ... until i messed up and groveled for him again; apologizing and saying that *I* was the toxic one. suddenly, he went right back to â€œbeing the bigger personâ€ and treated me like i was being immature, crazy, *lesser* than him.

after that last meltdown, i texted him that i was sorry, that i missed him, and that i wished him the best. i took him off of all my social media and deleted his number â€“ no blocks, just no more contact. 

after this complete cleanse, proving that i was *finally* ready to move on â€“ guess who appeared to have watched one of my instagram stories? But i know for a fact that wasnâ€™t *longing* â€“ he was in disbelief that I had really given up on him, that i was ready to move on and free myself from his drama. 

since then iâ€™ve had it happen twice where catfish accounts tried messaging me asking about what i was up to, if i was dating. for a while, any time iâ€™d run into him after that, he looked troubled â€“ unshaven, messy hair, weight gain; like someone who was actually going through it. maybe a coincidence, who knows?

what im saying from all this is that if its clear you want him back; heâ€™ll deny it from you to make you agonize over him. they like to feel desired, wanted; just like anyone else, its like a drug. The difference is they donâ€™t mind if it hurts you for them to get the satisfaction of knowing someone out there would give up their entire world for them. i know it hurts to see them completely unfazed by losing us, like we meant nothing to them â€“ trust me, he might not show it but he definitely wonâ€™t like it when he realizes heâ€™s truly lost control over your emotions.

also sorry for the prose lol im binging â€œYouâ€ on netflix and the constant monologues are in my head.

okay this is gonna take some being really up-front. this is the mindset that a lot of us have had and it helped us walk right into ruin. yes they are broken, sick people who probably have some nice qualities. yes, they can make you feel loved. yes, every one is deserving of love and compassion. thatâ€™s not your job though.

you are not here to fix him. no one can just â€œfixâ€ anyone and no amount of love is going to change him. even therapists donâ€™t just love people back into health, they help the person make change themselves using specific skills, but they have to *want* to change.

please understand that no amount of love and empathy is going to change him or fix him or bring light into his world. the only thing that can come of that is that you will break. weve all been there, im sure. â€œif i just try a little harder/love him a little more/wait out a few more storms i can be the change he needs in his lifeâ€ you didnt break him. you donâ€™t deserve to be broken trying to fix him.

the problem with narcissists and the reason they  dont change is because the problems they have feed into each other: theyll never get help or make changes because they canâ€™t see that they are the problem and nothing you do will change that. self-love isnt just telling yourself you like your reflection; its choosing your own needs and emotions and putting yourself first. thats not selfish, its self-preservation and learning to recognize when hurt outweighs healing.

i remember i accidentally broke my exâ€™s phone (during the lovebombing phase no less) and i was more upset than he was. â€œtheyâ€™re just thingsâ€ he said. i paid for the replacement but he started the new phone without backing it up â€“ no need to recover lost photos or anything. he didnâ€™t care, they were just things. just like when i couldnâ€™t take his abuse anymore, he replaced me too.

wow now that you mention it mine used to say the same thing! he used to talk about how i wouldnâ€™t love the real him â€“ the sad part is i still did; in the way you might love a problem child.

thank you im steadily making peace with it as it heads towards the past, i hope the same for you! Merry Christmas to you as well!

i guess it goes both ways then cause i only loved the mask he wore at the beginning; the person underneath was mean, stuck-up, and disrespectful. in a way its kinda sad for them because they overidealize us but we go in as who we really are; they put forward a fantasy that *they* cant even live up to.
